title: Integrated Competency Development Course Through Financial Statement Analysis Projects Using Mathematical Modeling (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic accounting principles and financial statement components, proficiency in formula calculations and data processing using Excel, and comprehension of fundamental statistical concepts
context.additional_context: A project-based outcome incorporating financial data analysis experience as a practicing professional, including mathematical modeling and computational verification processes, aiming to cultivate quantitative analytical skills applicable to real-world work environments.

learning_goals: Learners mathematically calculate 15 key financial ratios using selected corporate financial statements and interpret their meanings from a statistical perspective.
Learners write a 10-page research report based on analysis results, applying APA-style academic standards and data visualization in graphs and tables.
Learners experience providing and receiving feedback on mathematical modeling and computational accuracy during peer review, and perform two or more report revisions.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
